frameDefinitions: An Experiencer is in a State where a biological urge is signaling the need to perform a certain action such as eating, drinking, stopping exertion, sleeping, regurgitating, or having sex.
The obtaining of a Requirement state of affairs or the presence of a Required_entity is profiled as a prerequisite for the obtaining or occurring of a Dependent state-of-affairs.
A Mother and Father produce a Child or an Egg. 'Betty bore Gerry three intelligent daughters.'
The LUs in this frame describe the level that a Rate, or the variation in some quantity over a period of time, deviates from the norm.

A Manner describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways:  First, it can refer to how a Comparison_event transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. 'the way you talk').

This frame describes a particular compounding construction (a pattern of coinage) by which more complex words can be created by joining an Honored_entity to a Dedicated_type to describe a particular Dedicated_entity which has been officially named for the Honored_entity.
frameExamples: The <t>rapid</t> increase in obesity is a major cause of concern.
He completed the task in a fervent <t>manner</t>.
1st layer:  Turn right at the <t>Jefferson Building</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> receives the biological signal and possesses the internal experience which is a reaction to the phsyical signal.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is used for a gesture, expression, or body part indicating that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is feeling a certain urge.
<fen>State</fen> identifies the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s state of being.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels the biological signal. <fen>Time</fen> may also allow inference about the <fen>Reason</fen> for the biological urge.
This role identifies the  <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels the biological signal.
The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the state of affairs of the <fen>Requirement</fen> or the presence of the <fen>Required_entity</fen>.
The state-of-affairs that must obtain in order for the <fen>Dependent</fen> to obtain.
An entity that has to be present for the <fen>Dependent</fen> state of affairs to obtain.
The time at which the <fen>Requirement</fen> is necessary for the <fen>Dependent</fen>.
<fen>Place</fen> denotes a location in which the specified relation between <fen>Requirement</fen> and <fen>Dependent</fen> holds.
<fen>Mother</fen> is the female creature that produces the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Child</fen> identifies the new self-motile creature produced from the <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen>.
<fen>Father</fen> is the male creature that copulates with the <fen>Mother</fen>, thus  leading to the birth of the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Egg</fen> is an immobile object containing an organism that may hatch as a mobile, infant organism.
The <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen> expressed together.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The <fen>Event</fen> whose <fen>Rate</fen> is being described.
The <fen>Rate</fen> at which something happens during an <fen>Event</fen>.

The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
The description of the <fen>Comparison_event</fen> or <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
A description of the <fen>Manner</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described.
This role identifies the person, subject, or event that is being honored.
This role identifies the type of entity that had been dedicated to honor the <fen>Honored_entity</fen>.
The entity which has been dedicated to the <fen>Honored_entity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: He gave me a tired <fex>shrug</fex> and then looked down again.
She was alarmed by John's hungry <fex>state</fex>.
Believe it or not, but this cake requires <fex>a pound of mild sausage</fex>.
<fex>In the US</fex>, putting this on the agenda requires the political weight and leadership of big city mayors.
Female clownfish lay <fex>their eggs</fex> around sea anemones
<fex>We</fex> are going to be having twins!
Anthony marveled at the rapid <fex>rate</fex> of production.
We have a picnic every year on <fex>Veterans'</fex>  day.
The <fex><t>Jimmy Hoffa Building</t></fex> hasn't opened yet.
